abstract: The government is sharply limiting the ability of dissidents to communicate and upload videos of protests, according to several activists in Syria.
snippet: The government is sharply limiting the ability of dissidents to communicate and upload videos of protests, according to several activists in Syria.
lead_paragraph: The Syrian government is cracking down on protesters’ use of social media and the Internet to promote their rebellion just three months after allowing citizens to have open access to Facebook and YouTube, according to Syrian activists and digital privacy experts.

headline.main: Seeking to Disrupt Protesters, Syria Cracks Down on Social Media
headline.print_headline: Seeking to Disrupt Protesters, Syria Cracks Down on Social Media

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
